Jeff,

I wanted to share this now so that it doesn’t come across as a surprise later.

We believe Card Connect is probably going to make a slight pivot in their overall strategy to one that is similar to Shift4 in that
they are going to begin building products for and catering to independent software vendors (ISVs) in order deliver on many of
the original motivations around the First Data acquisition. The rationale for this assumption is outlined below.

    •  Card Connect acquired a company called Bolt a little over a year ago that would be best defined as a device management
        gateway. They competed with us a bit in hospitality.

    •   Bolt reminded me of a very early stage version of Shift4 in that it mirrored many of the components of what we built in

        1999-2004 timeframe. I am attaching their website from about 18 months ago which supported this.

    •	In short, Bolt provided similar capabilities to our 4Go product except they connected to almost every terminal type (Verifone,

        Ingenico, etc.) and we only supported Verifone at the time.
    •   Card Connect, with Bolt, can now offer a single EMV certification across nearly every major processor to ISVs, which can
        be a compelling product offering. This is what we pitched ISVs from 2004 until the launch of our payment gateway in
        2012.
    •   Card Connect has already communicated to a number of large software companies, and at least one has already signed
        for this service, that they will begin supporting an ISV / software company program similar to Shift4 within a year.

We are operating under the assumption it is only a matter of time until they are successful with this strategy.

Thanks,

Jared

Jeff,

I wanted to share this now so that it doesn’t come across as a surprise later.

We believe Card Connect is probably going to make a slight pivot in their overall strategy to one that is similar to Shift4 in that
they are going to begin building products for and catering to independent software vendors (ISVs) in order deliver on many of
the original motivations around the First Data acquisition. The rationale for this assumption is outlined below.

•	Card Connect acquired a company called Bolt a little over a year ago that would be best defined as a device management
gateway. They competed with us a bit in hospitality.
•	Bolt reminded me of a very early stage version of Shift4 in that it mirrored many of the components of what we built in
1999-2004 timeframe. I am attaching their website from about 18 months ago which supported this.
•	In short, Bolt provided similar capabilities to our 4Go product except they connected to almost every terminal type (Verifone,
Ingenico, etc.) and we only supported Verifone at the time.
•	Card Connect, with Bolt, can now offer a single EMV certification across nearly every major processor to ISVs, which can
be a compelling product offering. This is what we pitched ISVs from 2004 until the launch of our payment gateway in
2012.
•	Card Connect has already communicated to a number of large software companies, and at least one has already signed
for this service, that they will begin supporting an ISV / software company program similar to Shift4 within a year.

We are operating under the assumption it is only a matter of time until they are successful with this strategy.

Thanks,
Jared
